P003947.project_name: Small and Medium Industrial Enterprise (SMIE) Project

keywords.cdata: Bank Indonesia,Bank of Indonesia,Bank Performance,banking sector,banking system,Banks,branches,business environment,commercial banks,Company,competitiveness,corporations,credit risk,deposits,deregulation,Development Projects,diversification,economic growth,employment,Enterprise Development,entrepreneurs,equity markets,exchange rate,expansion,Expenditures,exports,Financial Institutions,financial intermediaries,Financial Intermediation,Financial Policies,financial sector,firms,FISCAL YEAR,foreign exchange,foreign markets,GDP,imports,income,INDUSTRIAL ENTERPRISES,industrialization,institutional development,Insurance,interest rate,interest rates,intermediate goods,inventory,large enterprises,lending rates,licensing,liquidity,macroeconomic stability,manufacturing enterprises,monetary policy,net worth,now accounts,oil,oil prices,policy environment,pollution,pollution abatement,pollution control,private banks,private commercial banks,producers,productivity,regional development banks,regulatory framework,resource use,river basins,savings,scale enterprises,small enterprises,small scale enterprises,state banks,Subsidiary,suppliers,surcharges,Sustainable Development,Tariff Barriers,taxation,Technical Assistance,technical training,term finance,trade reforms,transaction costs,Working Capital

project_abstract.cdata: By providing high quality, cost-effective technical assistance and unsubsidized term credit, the Small and Medium Industrial Enterprise Project will help develop the small and medium enterprise (SMIE) segment of industrial enterprises. The project consists of an investment credit component and a technical assistance component. Term credit at market rates will be channelled through 13 participating banks to support approximately 700 subprojects to enable them to modernize, expand, and diversify in response to the improved economic environment. The technical assistance component will establish and implement an enterprise level assistance program to enable SMIEs to prepare high quality investment proposals.
